author: Then_Government_9787
comment: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/publish/using-the-ftp-service/scenario-build-an-ftp-site-on-iis https://debug.to/6419/how-to-install-iis-in-windows-11 Hi here are some resources that can help you with that part. For setting up of FTP Site, do only till step 2. Please understand that you can't copy entirely there are some parts where you need to improvise. Here are some things to take note: Make sure your up address is correct Make sure you have created your cert and used the correct one Make sure your firewall is configured to allow ftp (hint: firewall support & inbound firewall) Make sure your winscp is installed properly, when connecting make sure it's the correct up address, username and password MOST IMPORTANTLY: please make sure you have not done ur CIS benchmark rectification. Or else none of this will work and you will need a new vm. Hope this helps :) Good luck!!
analysis:
```json
{
  "sentiment": "positive",
  "topics": ["IT Support", "Technical Troubleshooting"],
  "complaints": [],
  "suggestions": [
    "Make sure your IP address is correct",
    "Make sure you have created your certificate and used the correct one",
    "Make sure your firewall is configured to allow FTP",
    "Make sure your WinSCP is installed properly and you are using the correct IP address, username, and password",
    "Ensure you have not completed your CIS benchmark rectification (otherwise a new VM is needed)"
  ]
}
```

author: definitelytroaxx
comment: inside ur project specs there is a link to follow under the VM NAT nonsense, just follow that n u will be fine... it also tells u how to install IIS then after that use ur own laptop and download winscp to connect and test the connection edit: if u got connection timeout or access denied u didn't set the ftp site properly, you need to use a SSL self signed certificate when installing the ftp server. jiayous!
